Health Support Services

Essential health and safety supplies, harm reduction resources, and overdose response kits that reduce health risks and support wellness in our community.

Home Programs & Services Health Support Services

Our Approach to Health Support

Our Health Support Services program recognizes that access to basic health and safety supplies is fundamental to dignity and wellbeing. We provide essential supplies, harm reduction resources, and overdose response kits without judgment, while connecting people to healthcare services and support.

Harm Reduction Philosophy

We believe that every person deserves access to health information and supplies that can reduce risk and promote safety. Our harm reduction approach meets people where they are, providing practical tools and information that can prevent illness, injury, and death while respecting individual choices and circumstances.

Safe Supply Distribution

We distribute sterile supplies and safety equipment through multiple access points including our outreach teams, fixed locations, and community partners. All supplies are provided free of charge and without requiring identification or personal information.

Overdose Prevention & Response

Our program includes comprehensive overdose prevention education and response training. We distribute naloxone kits (Narcan), provide training on recognizing and responding to overdoses, and connect people with treatment and recovery resources when requested.

Service Information

Supply Access

  • Monday - Friday: 9:00 AM - 4:00 PM
  • Mobile outreach: Daily
  • Emergency supplies: 24/7

Access Points

  • IHARC main office
  • Mobile outreach unit
  • Community partner locations
  • Special events and outreach

Overdose Emergency

If someone has overdosed:

1. Call 911 immediately

2. Use naloxone if available

3. Stay with the person

Get Supplies or Information

Available Supplies & Resources

All supplies are provided free of charge and without requiring identification. We respect privacy and dignity in all our interactions.

Harm Reduction Kit

  • • Sterile needles and syringes
  • • Alcohol prep pads
  • • Tourniquets
  • • Sterile water
  • • Safe disposal containers
  • • Condoms and safer sex supplies

Naloxone (Narcan) Kits

  • • Pre-loaded naloxone injectors
  • • Nasal spray naloxone
  • • Emergency response instruction cards
  • • Training on proper use
  • • Replacement supplies available
  • • No questions asked distribution

Personal Care Items

  • • Toothbrushes and toothpaste
  • • Soap and shampoo
  • • Feminine hygiene products
  • • Razors and shaving cream
  • • Hand sanitizer
  • • First aid supplies

Wound Care Supplies

  • • Sterile gauze pads
  • • Medical tape
  • • Antibiotic ointment
  • • Bandages and wraps
  • • Wound cleaning solutions
  • • Basic pain relievers

Information & Education

  • • Safe use information cards
  • • Overdose recognition guides
  • • Health resource directories
  • • Treatment program information
  • • Mental health support resources
  • • Legal rights information

Safe Disposal Services

  • • Sharps containers
  • • Container exchange program
  • • Drop-off locations
  • • Mobile collection service
  • • Community cleanup support
  • • Safe disposal education

Training & Education Programs

We provide comprehensive training and education to individuals, families, and community organizations to build capacity for harm reduction and overdose response.

Naloxone Training

What You'll Learn:

  • • Recognizing signs of overdose
  • • Proper naloxone administration
  • • When and how to call for help
  • • What to do after naloxone is given
  • • Personal safety considerations

Duration: 30-45 minutes
Cost: Free, including take-home naloxone kit
Available: Individual or group training

Request Training

Community Education

Topics Available:

  • • Understanding addiction and mental health
  • • Harm reduction principles
  • • Stigma reduction and language
  • • Supporting family members
  • • Community safety approaches
  • • Trauma-informed responses

Audiences: Community groups, workplaces, schools, faith communities, service clubs
Format: Presentations, workshops, information sessions

Book a Presentation

Access Health Support Services

All services are confidential, non-judgmental, and provided free of charge. No appointment necessary for basic supplies.

Call Us

(905) 555-HELP

For supplies, training, or information

Visit Our Office

123 Main Street
Cobourg, ON K9A 2N4
Mon-Fri: 9:00 AM - 4:00 PM

Mobile Outreach

Our mobile unit brings supplies directly to the community. Call to request a visit or find our current location.

No Barriers Access

We believe everyone deserves access to health supplies. No ID required, no questions asked, no judgment. We're here to help keep you safe and healthy.
